intro: Isotrema faucimaculatum, commonly known as the spotted leaf isotrema, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with distinctive spots, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Isotrema faucimaculatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
